page.title: 04THE ARRETON VALLEY NURSERIES
page.content: Much of the Arreton Valley is devoted to the growing of commercial crops. There are a number of nurseries that grow everything from produce to garden shrubs and plants. Several acres of land are under glass. The area is the centre of growing on the Isle of Wight and the nurseries supply the florists and fruit and vegetable shops on the Island and the produce etc. is also transported to the mainland. The nursery industry has only been developed into a commercially viable proposition during the past 20 years. All the present centres have been established during this time. One such nursery is Springbank run by the Hall family. The Arreton Valley is ideal for this industry because it enjoys a high intensity of light.
